titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Irving title abstract and deed 1981.007
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:16:31 +0000.

did.unittitle: George Irving title abstract and deed

physdesc.extent: in one folder in one oversize box.

did.abstract: One photocopy of a title abstract granting farmland in Flushing, Queens County, N.Y., commonly known as Willetts Neck, to George Irving, and one photocopy of a deed from Irving to the United States Government for the sale of the land. The title abstract includes a history of the ownership of the property stretching back to 1798. The original documents both date from 1857.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1981.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Mininally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); George Irving title abstract and deed, 1981.007, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
